messages.subject: Chinese lettering was syllable
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/17/02 12:38:03 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/17/02 12:38:03 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< should have books on Chinese brush
calligraphy, and there will be characters, although maybe too fancy to
follow
in some cases. >>

I tried to buy a chinese brush calligraphy set at Pier 1 but they were sold
out by the time I got back there. I could try the local art store...they're
sure to have something.
And the more fancy, the better. This kid can copy anything just about. It
amazes me.
He draws fascinating detail into his dragons and spends hours copying the
Japanese symbols...it's all very bizarre and really cool.
Thanks for the ideas. I feel very lost on this topic.
Ren
